p: This group of plants comprises small trees, shrubs, and perennial herbs. The woody species are commonly found in gardens and some have edible fruits. Within the five genera found, the smallest ( Adoxa, Sinadoxa, and Tetradoxa) are exclusively herbaceous, while the largest ( Viburnum and Sambucus) are both woody and herbaceous. There are around 225 species worldwide, predominantly in temperate regions of Asia, Europe, and North America. The genus Viburnum also grows in tropical mountains. Sambucus spp., known as elderberries, accounts for 10 species (small trees and shrubs) and several of them produce fruits that are edible (if cooked). European elderberry ( Sambucus nigra) is commonly used in herbal medicine.
